ResearchProjectDef.label: Drones
ResearchProjectDef.description: These are highly advanced, automated robots, capable of carrying out automated tasks without a operator.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Micro-drones
ResearchProjectDef.description: Swarms of mini drones, assisting the user in various tasks.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Nanites
ResearchProjectDef.description: If micro-drone technologies were small, these are tiny. These tiny computer systems are basic, but when combined can help do many things, like prevent diseases.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Nano-machinery
ResearchProjectDef.description: Through the use of highly specialsed nanites composed of highly resistant materials, we may create self-healing structures, and more.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Basic Robotics
ResearchProjectDef.description: Basic mechanical systems. These designs are good for making basic limb replacements.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Basic Augments
ResearchProjectDef.description: These augments are designed to keep the user mostly alive. Nothing more, nothing less.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Advanced Augments
ResearchProjectDef.description: The few decrypted blueprints outlined in this database appear to be even better then current designs we have access to. We may want to decrypt the rest.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Elite Augments
ResearchProjectDef.description: This database has some of, if not the most advanced augments ever designed.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Advanced Robotics
ResearchProjectDef.description: Newer, advanced motors allow for better designs, with higher ranges of motion, speed, and general enhancements.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Basic weapon augments
ResearchProjectDef.description: Weaponised augments. These make the user much more dangerous.
